data.title: Reset the package's local storage setting if loading cannot be deferred
data.body:
Hi there, it’s been a while since I last got some time to work on Atom.

So this PR attempt to fix an annoying issue I struggled with for months now, without being able to figure when it came from, but I finally found an explanation. I initially reported it in #9677, but without any clue as to why it was not working properly the issue was closed expected.

So now, let’s enter the main topic. 

Let’s say we create a new package, we’re running it in dev mode, and for the moment there’s no deserializers or registered views for that package. 

When requiring the main module, we will end up passing in [this branch](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/package.coffee#L442-L444) that will set the `getCanDeferMainModuleRequireStorageKey()` flag to `true`.

Now if we start adding deserializers into our package, since the flag is never turned off, the package main module loading will always be deferred on activation as [this condition will always be true](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/package.coffee#L102), resulting in error if the there’s serialized pane items that need to be deserialized. 

Of course, as these settings are scoped using the package version, this is generally not an issue with published packages. If serializers or views are added between two versions the local storage keys will be different  and the previous value will be ignored.

However, this issue is making developing a package that have serializers seriously complicated as there’s no longer a way to test them in dev mode once we entered that state (unless knowing that this local storage setting must be removed).

A simple solution here is to simply remove the local storage item if we find that the package now has deserializers or registered views that it didn’t have before.

data.title: File --> Open... not functional after closing editor Window (OS X)
data.body:
In Atom version 1.9.9 on OS X, when you try to open a Project from the File menu after closing the editor window, the FInder file selection pane does not pop-up as expected.  

To reproduce this:
1. Open Atom
2. Close the main 'untitled' window
3. Try to Open a project or Add a project folder

The Atom menu bar remains open after closing the main window after launch, so you would assume that you could Open... a new project from the menu and I'm sure this used to work in version 1.8.x. 

Atom    : 1.9.9
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0

data.title: newly installed Atom 1.9.9 in Ubuntu 16.04 (unity) - *poor* font rendering
data.body:
I've used Atom editor for a long while.  I just installed an Ubuntu 16.04 instance and with it the newest version of Atom, 1.9.9.  The fonts aren't rendering in the Atom editor as they used to, in prior versions.  I've tried a range of different fonts using the fonts package.  I've tried to tweak my stylesheet yet still no improvement:

.editor {
  -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;
}

This is what my editor looks like, using the Iosevka font:  http://imgur.com/a/NXhKq

Please, help.  This font rendering problem is a show-stopper for me as it is affecting focus.

data.title: `console.log` in a plugin causes a "EPERM: operation not permitted, write"
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

The bug has since been reported in several places. The current use case that bothers is that `console.log` is used in the [`eslint-plugin-react`](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react) which is used in the widely adopted [`eslint-config-airbnb`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/eslint-config-airbnb) which is in turn consumed by [`eslint`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/eslint) and [`AtomLinter/linter-eslint`](https://github.com/AtomLinter/linter-eslint).
- https://github.com/AtomLinter/linter-eslint/issues/579 (closed because the AtomLinter team cannot do anything with that)
- https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/issues/416#issuecomment-177119027 (closed because the issue was not stated properly, or simply comments on closed issues were ignored)
- https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues/978#issuecomment-241332995 (can't be fixed in eslint-config-airbnb yet because of other dependencies)
- https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/issues/783#issuecomment-241778161 (looks like a won't fix because eslint-plugin-react "is a Node module, so using console is valid")

Here's the exception that pops up in Atom:

```
Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, write
    at Error (native)
    at Object.fs.writeSync (fs.js:706:20)
    at SyncWriteStream.write (fs.js:2064:6)
    at Console.log (console.js:39:16)
    at EventEmitter.Program (__CENSORED__\node_modules\eslint-plugin-react\lib\rules\require-extension.js:103:17)
    at emitOne (events.js:95:20)
    at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:182:7)
    at NodeEventGenerator.enterNode (__CENSORED__\node_modules\eslint\lib\util\node-event-generator.js:40:22)
    at CodePathAnalyzer.enterNode (__CENSORED__\node_modules\eslint\lib\code-path-analysis\code-path-analyzer.js:608:23)
    at CommentEventGenerator.enterNode (__CENSORED__\node_modules\eslint\lib\util\comment-event-generator.js:97:23)
```

Here's one of the faulty lines:
https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/blob/v3.16.1/lib/rules/jsx-quotes.js#L52

``` js
      /* eslint-disable no-console */
      console.log('The react/jsx-quotes rule is deprecated. Please use the jsx-quotes rule instead.');
      /* eslint-enable no-console */
      isWarnedForDeprecation = true;
```

There are more occurences of this pattern in `eslint-plugin-react`:
https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/blob/e84af68a3bf48c9a34f14e73a8b4dc1ed7488bab/lib/rules/require-extension.js#L103

``` js
        /* eslint-disable no-console */
        console.log('The react/require-extension rule is deprecated. Please ' +
                    'use the import/extensions rule from eslint-plugin-import instead.');
        /* eslint-enable no-console */
        isWarnedForDeprecation = true;
```

https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=console.log&type=Code
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Install `atom-linter`, `atom-linter-eslint` plugins, `eslint` and `eslint-plugin-react` modules.
2. Use a `.eslintrc` that uses one of the `eslint-plugin-react`'s deprecated rules; for example, the `eslint-config-airbnb` base config.
3. Run the linting on a JS file.

**Expected behavior:** No error.

**Actual behavior:** The exception mentioned above.
### Versions

Atom 1.9.9 on Windows 7 64bit

`atom --version`

```
Atom    : 1.9.9
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
```

`apm --version`

```
apm  1.10.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 3.5.0
git 1.9.4.msysgit.1
visual studio
```

data.title: Update languages
data.body:
~~Do not merge; more language updates coming soon!~~
All language updates are done.

Too tired to write up a detailed changelog, but here are the major things to look out for:
- YAML support got seriously improved with this latest release.  But with serious improvements comes the potential for serious regressions, so that might be something to keep an eye out for.
- language-c got a fix ported from the textmate bundle!  Yay!
- Tons of JS improvements, especially regarding JSDoc and object keys.  Again, also has the possibility of regressions.

data.title: Add atom.project.observeBuffers
data.body:
This makes `onDidAddBuffer` symmetrical with other `onDidAddX` methods and their `observeXs`. It also documents `onDidAddBuffer` and adds tests for it.

Released under CC0.

data.title: macOS: When Atom window is closed and re-opened, the app completely rerenders
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Everytime the Atom window is opened, it re-renders the whole UI. This is in contrast with the behavior of all the other macOS applications.  
Usually when you close an application with the red button and then you re-open it from Dock, the UI is instantly available exactly as you left it when the window was closed.
Seems like there are two different problems:
1. The UI completely re-renders on window open
2. The window state is not preserved when the window is re-opened

Logically I have not checked "Open empty editor on start".
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open an Atom's window
2. Open a project, a file, a tab, whatever
3. Close the opened Atom's window using the red button
4. Click on the Atom icon in the Dock to re-open the window

**Expected behavior:** The window is instantly re-opened and I can continue from where I left.

**Actual behavior:** The window is created from scratch, takes several seconds to render its content, and once rendered, I have to reopen the tab/project I was using before I closed it.
### Versions

```
~$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.11.0-dev-579e6b2
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
~$ apm --version
apm  1.12.5
npm  3.10.5
node 4.4.5
python 2.7.12
git 2.9.2
```

The same problem happens with all the Atom versions

data.title: Atom doesn't remember added projects on start up
data.body:
This is a known limitation of the window state system; it only saves when changing focus, adding and removing windows. We should save when adding and removing project folders in addition.

## Repro Steps
1. Launch Atom in a local repository
2. Add a second project folder using <kbd>Cmd+Shift+O</kbd>
3. Exit Atom
4. Launch Atom using the Dock icon

**Expected:** Both project folders to be listed in the Tree View
**Actual:** Only the first project folder is listed in the Tree View

Info:
- version 1.9.9 (the bug also existed on 1.9.8)
- Mac OS 10.10.5
- "Open empty editor at start" is unchecked

data.title: Atom doesn't remember added projects to the tree view
data.body:
Scenario:
- add projects to the tree view, open some files, modify files and save
- close Atom with cmd+q
- open Atom again and it opens empty window

Info
- version 1.9.9 (the bug also existed on 1.9.8)
- Mac OS 10.10.5
- "Open empty editor at start" is unchecked

data.title: Tooltip with file path stay after closing pane
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

A tooltip with a file path stay on the screen after closing a pane if the contextual menu is brought by clicking on a actual file tab.

![tooltip-bug-1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/968164/17837224/edac6294-67e7-11e6-9f06-5f282d086740.png)
![tooltip-bug-2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/968164/17837225/ee005818-67e7-11e6-84e5-6ed84f04c506.png)
![tooltip-bug-3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/968164/17837228/ee0d1d82-67e7-11e6-877d-28374f174078.png)
![tooltip-bug-4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/968164/17837226/ee062a86-67e7-11e6-9486-63e1b3413147.png)
![tooltip-bug-5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/968164/17837227/ee0667ee-67e7-11e6-9387-33717a76d440.png)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a file
2. Split the pane (any direction)
3. Close a pane with the cursor on a file tab

**Expected behavior:**

The pane is closed and no tooltip with the file path is shown

**Actual behavior:**

The pane is closed but an unremovable tooltip with the file path stays on screen.
The tooltip will finally disappear if the window is resized.
### Versions

Both versions: Atom 1.9.9 and Atom beta 1.10.0-beta6 on OS X 10.11.6

data.title: Projects window session restored, last file open not restored
data.body:
### Update

All is OK when open atom as super user ( root )
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Atom project window session restored but anything last file open not restored ( included not saved file )
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Atom Editor
2. Unchecked Empty Editor On Start
   - then set atom core config restorePreviousWindowsOnStart: true
3. Try to open file tab from existing window project
4. Close Atom Editor
5. Open again, only window project opened ( empty editor )
6. Close Atom Editor
7. Try to 
   - delete atom compile cache
   - delete atom storage
8. Open Atom Editor
9. Add Project Folder and open file tab from project file
10. Close Atom Editor
11. Open Atom Editor ( empty editor )

**Expected behavior:** 
- Any last file should be opened, not only project window
- Any unsaved file should be restored when open

**Actual behavior:**  Only project window opened with empty editor on start
### Versions

Atom    : 1.9.8
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
OS : Linux Mint Cinnamon 18 64-bit

data.title: load initialPaths for first new-window event
data.body:
Fix bug https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/11361

1、On macOS,  the sate is not saved when the last window is removed because the progress is running, so "removeWindow" function must be updated to :

> `@saveState(false) unless window.isSpec`

2、We must load paths from '.atom/storage/application.json' for the first window  when the application is running and no window, especially on macOS
